workflow.name: 50-sap-simplestack
workflow.longdesc:
Configure a SAP instance including:
1) virtual IP addresses for each of the SAP instance services - ASCS, DB and CI, 2) a RAID 1 host based mirror, 3) a cluster manager LVM volume group and LVM volumes on the RAID 1 host based mirror, 4) fileystems on shared storage for sapmnt, /sapbd and /usr/sap, 5) SAPinstance for - ASCS, a Database, a Central Instance.

parameters.stepdesc: ID for the SAP simple stack resource group.

parameter.name: id
parameter.longdesc: Unique ID for the SAP SimpleStack instance resource group in the cluster.

template.name: raid1
template.stepdesc: RAID1 volume which starts before the LVM volume group and holds a LVM volume group and LVM volumes.

template.name: lvm
template.stepdesc: LVM logical volumes for the SAP filesystems.

template.name: sap-filesystem-sapmnt
template.stepdesc:
Filesystem resource for the sapmnt directory.
If a filesystem does not already exist on the block device specified here, you will need to run mkfs to create it, prior to starting the filesystem resource. You will also need to create the mountpoint directory on all cluster nodes.

override.name: operations
override.value: op stop timeout=300 op monitor interval=30 timeout=130

template.name: sap-virtual-ip-db
template.stepdesc: The IP address configured here will be for the SAP Database instance.

template.name: sap-filesystem-sapdb
template.stepdesc:
Filesystem for the SAP database (typically mounted on /sapdb).
If a filesystem does not already exist on the block device specified here, you will need to run mkfs to create it, prior to starting the filesystem resource. You will also need to create the mountpoint directory on all cluster nodes.

override.name: operations
override.value: op stop timeout=300 op monitor interval=30 timeout=130

template.name: sap-sapinst-as
template.stepdesc: This is the SAP ASCS instance.

template.name: sap-virtual-ip-as
template.stepdesc: The IP address configured here will be for the SAP ASCS instance.

template.name: sap-sapinst-ci
template.stepdesc: This is the SAP Central instance.

template.name: sap-virtual-ip-ci
template.stepdesc: The IP address configured here will be for the SAP Central Instance.

template.name: sap-filesystem-usrsap
template.stepdesc:
This filesystem is for the /usr/sap directory.
If a filesystem does not already exist on the block device specified here, you will need to run mkfs to create it, prior to starting the filesystem resource. You will also need to create the mountpoint directory on all cluster nodes.

override.name: operations
override.value: op stop timeout=300 op monitor interval=30 timeout=130
